column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Two more Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Tuesday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column4: up from 948 cases recorded on Monday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column5: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.A total of 277
column6: 334 cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in Northern Ireland since the pandemic began.On Tuesday
column7: there were 381 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals in Northern Ireland
column8: up from 326 on Monday.There are currently 36 Covid patients in intensive care units
column9: the same number as Monday.Last updated 2 November at 14:15 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column11: 447 vaccines for Covid-19 have been administered in Northern Ireland as of Tuesday.A total of 1
column13: 920 people have received their second dose and 9
column14: 858 people have received their third dose.A total of 87
column15: 776 people have received their booster dose.Last updated 2 November at 14:15 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandThe total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
